results.title: Ingress (2013)
results.brief_description: Ingress (or Ingress Prime) is an augmented reality (AR) mobile game developed and published by Niantic for Android and iOS devices.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.description: Welcome to the world of Ingress, Agent. The discovery of XM, a mysterious resource of unknown origin, has sparked a covert struggle between two distinct Factions.
description_for_label: Welcome to the world of Ingress, Agent. The discovery of XM, a mysterious resource of unknown origin, has sparked a covert struggle between two distinct Factions.

results.title: Infertility
results.brief_description: Introduced by Professor Carl Wood, this program looks at the various causes of infertility in humans. The documentary is presented in a simple manner and is designed to give basic information to couples who are having trouble conceiving. The sequel is titled, “The Alternatives to Infertility”.

results.title: Industrial provinces of Canada
results.brief_description: Ontario and Quebec, as the main industrial provinces of Canada, link Canada with the United States of America, and with the rest of the world, through the products of their industries. Mining, manufacturing, and agriculture in these two provinces make them vitally important to the well-being of the other Canadian provinces.

results.title: Industrial power service
results.brief_description: An outline of the characteristics and advantages of pneumatic power across a wide range of industries. Shows how air tools can perform a wide range of tasks from polishing to rivetting.

results.title: Indonesian conversations
results.creator_credit: Marisa Sara and University of Western Sydney
results.brief_description: Ten short segments dramatise a typical situation in which a tourist may find themselves whilst travelling in Indonesia. The purpose is to present aspects of colloquial language in a meaningful context. Scripted conversations include asking directions, visiting a post office, buying food and snacks and eating in a warung. It should be noted that the language and expressions are “real life” Indonesian from the city of Yogyakarta. Students will also gain some appreciation of the cultural differences between Australia and Indonesia. Accompanied by a Study Guide.

results.title: Indigenous Australians : an Aboriginal community focus
results.brief_description: An interactive CDROM from NSW TAFE which is the first to draw on the comprehensive knowledge and expertise of Aboriginal community members and is an invaluable teaching resource. The concept behind the CD ROM is to let members of various Aboriginal communities become teachers of their rich culture. A resource guide accompanies the CD ROM.
